operator.name: Argosy Cruises

products.title: Seattle Harbor Cruise
products.shortDescription: 1-hour narrated sightseeing cruise around Elliott Bay with views of the Seattle skyline, shipping port, and mountain ranges.
products.description: During this 1-hour cruise around Elliott Bay, experience all the beauty and history Seattle has to offer. Spend time with a local guide, learning about Seattle's historic waterfront and getting an up-close look at one of the west coast's largest shipping terminals. Take in the view of the city's skyline with a spectacular panoramic background of the Cascade and Olympic mountain ranges, including majestic Mount Rainier, making for the perfect photo op.
products.pricingNotes: Price includes taxes and online ticketing fee. Prices are in USD.

features.value: Live local guide narration on Seattle's history and waterfront
Panoramic and up-close views of the Seattle skyline and shipping port
Sweeping views of the Olympic Mountains and Puget Sound
Full-service bar on board with cocktails, local wine and beer, non-alcoholic beverages and snacks available for purchase
Indoor seating and outdoor space
Restrooms on board
Food and beverages (available for purchase on board)
No outside food or drink allowed onboard
Seattle's Original Harbor Cruise™
Available via Seattle CityPASS® — save up to 50%
ADA accessible — crew trained to help guests with wheelchairs, strollers, scooters. Call 206.623.1445 for specific ADA questions.
Boarding begins about 20 minutes prior to departure. Seating is first-come, first-served.
Cruise route is approximate and can change based on weather, vessel traffic, and captain's discretion.

media.alt: Seattle Great Wheel: an enormous ferris wheel as seen from Argosy Cruise, with Seattle sky scrapers behind it

upgradeModifiers.name: First to Board
upgradeModifiers.description: Skip the line and be first to board, first to the bar, and first to pick the perfect seat. Plus, receive 15% off drinks your entire ride.

products.title: Seattle Locks Cruise
products.shortDescription: 2-hour one-way narrated cruise through the Hiram M. Chittenden (Ballard) Locks, connecting Puget Sound and Lake Washington Ship Canal.
products.description: Discover the best of Seattle on a scenic one-way cruise through the heart of the city and experience the iconic Hiram M. Chittenden (Ballard) Locks, a 'boat elevator' connecting Puget Sound and Lake Washington Ship Canal. On the saltwater of Puget Sound, take in breathtaking views of the city skyline and majestic mountain ranges. Then, glide through the freshwater canal for a closer look at historic neighborhoods, commercial fishing vessels, floating homes, seaplanes, and more. Along the way, enjoy captivating stories of Seattle's past and present from a live, local guide.
products.pricingNotes: Price includes taxes and online ticketing fee. Prices are in USD.

seasonality.notes: Year-round operation. In-person/walk up ticket sales available at AGC boarding location Fridays and Sundays.

features.value: Transit through the Hiram M. Chittenden (Ballard) Locks
Live local guide narration on Seattle's history
Up-close views of fishing vessels, seaplanes, and floating homes
Views of the Space Needle and Seattle skyline from both Lake Union and Elliott Bay
Full-service bar on board with cocktails, local wine and beer, non-alcoholic beverages and snacks available for purchase
Indoor and outdoor seating
Restrooms on board
Food and beverages (available for purchase on board)
No outside food or drink allowed onboard

products.title: Summer Views Cruise
products.shortDescription: 1.5-hour golden hour cruise around Elliott Bay, Alki Point, and into Puget Sound with minimal narration — perfect for socializing and sunset views.
products.description: Looking to have a drink with a view? Hop on our Summer Views Cruise! This 1.5-hour cruise is the perfect place to bask in golden hour as the sun begins to set. Head up to the top deck to take in that summer breeze and enjoy locally sourced beverages and bites while the captain takes you on a surprise route around Puget Sound and shares their favorite landmarks. This cruise is unique in that narration will be minimal so that you can socialize and take in the sights — like breathtaking views of the Seattle skyline and the Olympic Mountains.
products.pricingNotes: Price includes taxes and online ticketing fee. Prices are in USD. 2025 season has wrapped up; 2026 sailings available.

seasonality.notes: Seasonal — summer only. 2025 season wrapped; 2026 sailings on sale.

products.cancellationPolicy: Full refund until 48 hours before departure when Trip Protection is added.

features.value: 1.5-hour cruise around Elliott Bay, Alki Point, and into Puget Sound during golden hour
Full-service bar on board with cocktails, local wine and beer, non-alcoholic beverages and snacks available for purchase
Panoramic and up-close views of the Seattle skyline and shipping port
Sweeping views of the Olympic Mountains and Puget Sound
Indoor seating and outdoor space
Restrooms on board
No outside food or drink allowed onboard
Golden hour sunset cruise with minimal narration — perfect for socializing
ADA accessible — crew trained to help guests with wheelchairs, strollers, scooters. Call 206.623.1445 for specific ADA questions.

Arrive 30 minutes before departure.

faqs.question: Where can I buy tickets?
faqs.answer: You can buy tickets online or in person at the Argosy Cruises Reservations Center located at 1101 Alaskan Way Pier 55, Seattle, WA 98101.

faqs.question: Where do I board?
faqs.answer: You will board at Pier 54, 1001 Alaskan Way Seattle, WA 98104. Pier 54 is one pier south of the Argosy Cruises Reservation Center along the Seattle waterfront.

faqs.question: What time should I arrive?
faqs.answer: We recommend arriving 30 minutes before departure. Boarding begins about 20 minutes before departure, and seating is first come, first served.

faqs.question: What is the difference between Argosy's Harbor Cruise and the Summer Views Cruise?
faqs.answer: The Harbor Cruise is a 1-hour tour offering live narration. The Summer Views Cruise is a 1.5-hour cruise of Alki Point, Elliott Bay, and into Puget Sound at the perfect time in the evening to enjoy golden hour. There is no tour narration on the Summer Views Cruise — except a handful of must-mention moments from the captain.

faqs.question: What will I see on the Summer Views Cruise?
faqs.answer: Aside from the start of the beautiful Seattle sunset, you'll cruise out into Elliott Bay, passing the Seattle waterfront, Harbor Island, Alki Point, and into Puget Sound. You'll take in views of the Olympic Mountains and the city skyline, including an incredible look back at the Space Needle.

products.title: Private Views Cruise
products.shortDescription: 1.5-hour private group cruise with Sip & Savor food and beverage package included, designed for hassle-free corporate and social events for 25-130 guests.
products.description: Enjoy a 1.5-hour Private Views Cruise designed for simplicity and ease. This hassle-free, budget-friendly option offers stunning views and a relaxing atmosphere for groups who want to focus on fun without the stress of planning. Great for casual gatherings, small celebrations, and team events for 25-130 guests. Pricing is per person for added flexibility and includes our Sip & Savor food and beverage package. Available from the Seattle Waterfront select evenings April-September.

products.title: Christmas Ship™ Festival
products.shortDescription: 1.5-hour holiday cruise aboard the Spirit of Seattle™ with live choir performance, Santa, and festive atmosphere — a Pacific Northwest tradition since 1949.
products.description: The Argosy Cruises Christmas Ship™ Festival is a beloved Pacific Northwest tradition that has been lighting up the holidays since 1949. Each season, the Spirit of Seattle™—our Official Christmas Ship™—is adorned with hundreds of sparkling white lights and sails to nearly 40 waterfront communities across Puget Sound. On board, the choir fills the night air with festive music, serenading guests on the ship, passengers aboard follow boats, and joyful crowds gathered on shore.
products.pricingNotes: Pricing for 2026 not yet published. Adult (13+), Youth (4-12), and Kid (3 and under, free) tiers exist. Regular sailings and Special Events (Opening Night, Parade of Boats, Grand Finale) have different pricing. Check back for 2026 details.

ageRestrictions.notes: Kids 3 and under are free. 21+ Follow Boat is adults only (21+).

seasonality.notes: Holiday season only. Check back for 2026 details.

products.cancellationPolicy: Guests who cancel 10 days or more in advance of their departure date and time will be offered a 50% refund on the total amount paid (excluding non-refundable Ticketing Fee). Cancellations less than 10 days in advance will not be refunded. Future open credits will not be offered. Trip Protection is not available for Special Events.

faqs.question: What is the Christmas Ship™?
faqs.answer: The official Christmas Ship™, the Spirit of Seattle, is a family-friendly holiday experience on the water. When the Christmas Ship™ arrives at the designated parks, the choir on board sings a 20-minute concert which is broadcast to the surrounding boats and people onshore. Santa rides along to entertain, and a cruise director will guide you through the evening. Snacks, pre-wrapped food, and beverages are available for purchase.

faqs.question: What is the 21+ Follow Boat?
faqs.answer: The 21+ Follow Boat is another fully decorated Argosy Cruises boat that follows the Christmas Ship™ along the night's cruise route. This boat is adults-only and has select availability. It provides a fun holiday celebration for those 21+ with themed dress, light trivia, etc.

faqs.question: What is the Christmas Ship™ cancellation policy?
faqs.answer: Guests who cancel 10 days or more in advance of their departure date and time will be offered a 50% refund on the total amount paid (excluding non-refundable Ticketing Fee). Cancellations less than 10 days in advance will not be refunded. Future open credits will not be offered for any cancellations. Trip Protection is not available for Special Events.

faqs.question: Can I bring my peppermint mocha onboard?
faqs.answer: No outside food or beverages allowed onboard. The bar will have festive, specialty cocktails, local beer & wine, plus non-alcoholic beverages. Snacks, bites, and chowder will also be available to purchase on board.

faqs.question: Does the cruise ever get cancelled?
faqs.answer: We only cancel sailings if the mayor or governor declare a state of emergency due to weather or other causes.

faqs.question: How should I dress?
faqs.answer: Wear warm, comfortable clothing and flat shoes that are not smooth-soled. Stilettos are strongly discouraged. Most guests enjoy both indoor heated decks and outdoor spaces. Festive holiday attire is always encouraged!

faqs.question: Can I make a large group ticket reservation?
faqs.answer: When booking online, a MAX of 15 tickets is allowed. For group ticket interest, email cruises@argosycruises.com with group size, reason, company if applicable, and other details. For private holiday parties, reach out to the private charter department.

products.title: Christmas Ship™ 21+ Follow Boat
products.shortDescription: Adults-only 1.5-hour festive holiday cruise that follows the Spirit of Seattle™ Christmas Ship to a waterfront community, with themed party, trivia, and giveaways.
products.description: A festive and themed adults-only party! Hop on the 21+ boat and follow the Spirit of Seattle to a waterfront community. This experience includes a 1.5-hour cruise, light trivia & chances to win giveaways, selfie station & photo-op opportunities, and a full-service bar with specialty cocktails, local wine & beer, and non-alcoholic beverages.
products.pricingNotes: Pricing for 2026 not yet published. Adults only (21+).

products.title: Private Charters (Custom)
products.shortDescription: Fully customized private boat charters for corporate events, weddings, celebrations, and more on Seattle's waterways.
products.description: The best boat charters in Seattle start with Argosy Cruises. As Seattle's premier private charter provider for over 75 years, your options for parties, celebrations, corporate events, weddings, private tours, team building activities and entertaining are endless. Our skilled charter planning team is ready to help make your next private charter or corporate event a success. A fully customized experience, from the catering of your choice to the music, there is no shortage of fun when you charter a boat with us!
products.pricingNotes: Quote-based, no online pricing. Request a quote via the website.

features.value: Fully customized experience — catering, music, entertainment
Dedicated charter planning team
Seattle's premier private charter provider for over 75 years
Available for corporate events, weddings, school events, celebrations, team building, and more
Various cruise lengths and departure points available
